data.event: In 1870, John Marius Wilson's said that: Dalton, a township in Topcliffe parish, N. R.
There are chapels for Wesleyans and Primitive Methodists. . In 1890 Dalton was made up of 2,649 acres of land and 177 acres were covered in plantations.
A small ‘chapel of ease’ was created here in 1839 in which a service used to be held every second Sunday morning of the month, and every evening on all the other Sundays.

event.title: 1855 the Wesleyan Methodist Chapel was created

data.event: In 1855 the Wesleyan Methodist Chapel was created which was described as “a very small and plain building”.
The Lord in 1066 was called Bernwulf and the value to the lord was £4.
In 1943 it was allocated to No.6 Group Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF).
